Computer Parts

GPU

One kind of Graphics Card is a “discrete” graphics card, having a separate card. Another is integrated, which means it is built into the CPU. The microprocessor is busy doing other work so the video card helps it. Graphic cards take binary data from the CPU and turn it into a picture you can see. Some motherboards can have graphics capability built into it.

fun fact 1
The first version of windows was released on November 20th, 1985

fun fact 2
First mac os version came out in 1984.

fun fact 3
The term GPU was popularized by Nvidia in 1999, who marketed the GeForce 256 as "the world's first GPU", or Graphics Processing Unit, although the term had been in use since at least the 1980s.
